text:
(1)
Central Park: the Pond, showing two of the Park's swans and the famous swanboat. The tall building in the centre is the Hotel Pierre, with the small, white Metropolitan Club adjoining it. At the extreme right is a portion of the Sherry-Netherland.
May 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A similar view from the far side of the Pond. Note the absence of the Hotel Pierre in this scene.
May 30, 1909.

Walter L. Bogert.

(3)
A similar view in a westward direction, showing the twin towers of the San Remo in the background.
August 4, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond. [Metropolitan Club; Sherry-Netherland Hotel.]

text:
Central Park: The Pond; pedestrian bridge at an early date.

1910

Mulford Simonson Photo
P. L. Sperr Collection
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
(1)
Central Park, the Pond: the pedestrian bridge, looking west. Because of the dense foliage, Central Park West cannot be seen.
In the foreground is a mother duck with her brood.
1923.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, with Central Park West apartment houses in the background. Two wild ducks swim in the foreground; perhaps they are lineal
descendants of the babies shown in No. 1.
May 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same. One of the swans may be seen under the arch of the
bridge.
May 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
(1)
Central Park: the Pond, looking northeast towards the Fifth Avenue apartment houses.
March 28, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, seen from Central Park South.
June 8, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, with a flock of ducks in the foreground.
March 10, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
(1) and (2)
Central Park: A set of 2 views showing a pedestrian bridge crossing a neck of the Pond. The photographer, viewing westward, shows same in a wintery setting.

About 1930.

(3)
The same view in a summery garb. Buildings in the background are on Central Park West. Note the new apartment house to the left.

April 23, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
Central Park: A set of 3 views showing aspects of the Pond and a pedestrian bridge crossing a neck of same. The photographer viewing northwestward, shows same in a wintery garb.

About 1930.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
(1)
Central Park: the Pond, at the southeast corner of the Park. In the summer the Pond is a popular spot for boating; in the winter, it is crowded with ice-skaters. The buildings in the background are: the Plaza Hotel, at the extreme right; the Savoy-Plaza in the right centre; and the Sherry-Netherland in the centre.

May 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, looking southeast through the arch of the pedestrian bridge. The buildings in the background are: Plaza Hotel, at extreme right; the Squibb Building, with the flag; the Savoy-Plaza in the centre; and the Sherry-Netherland on the left.

May 15, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, taken from the bridge shown in No. 2. The buildings are the same, but between the Plaza and the Squibb Building may be seen the Bergdorf-Goodman store, which replaced the Vanderbilt Château.

May 15, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond. Bergdorf-Goodman Department Store; Plaza Hotel; Savoy-Plaza Hotel; Sherry-Netherland Hotel.

May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)

title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
(1)
Central Park: the Pond, showing a pair of the Park's swans. The disposition of these birds is notoriously bad.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same. The swans are separated by a boat.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

text:
Central Park: the Pond, looking northwest towards the Central Park West apartments from the pedestrian bridge.
May 21, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
Central Park: the Pond, showing the famous swanboat. Warm spring weather has brought out a crowd to enjoy an hour or so of boating. In the background is the Plaza Hotel.
May 21, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
Central Park: The Pond in the S.E. corner of the Park. This view is from the small pedestrian bridge and is in a southeastward direction to show the famous hotels located on the confines of this garden area. Shown from left to right are, the Ritz Tower, the Sherry-Netherland, the Savoy-Plaza Hotels and the Squibb Building (white, with flag thereon). On the right is the famous Plaza Hotel.

1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.

Negative photo stat available in 1/4 G. Neg. No.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
Central Park: A view southeastward across a corner of the Park, showing The Pond in the foreground with New York's major hotels for a background. This, a negative that has been reversed in the printing shows from left to right, The Plaza Hotel; the General Electric Building; the Squibb Building; the Savoy-Plaza and the Sherry Netherland Hotels.

About 1936

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.

Printed in reverse
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
Central Park: A corner of the Boat Lake (also known as the Pond) with several ducks that habituate this area.

About 1936.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
Central Park: Reflections in The Pond of New York's majestic hotel belt.
About 1936.

title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:
Central Park--The Pond: A girl feeding the swans.

1938-9

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.
